title: Making the Grade (TV series)
text:
Making the Grade is an American <a href="sitcom">sitcom</a> which aired on <a href="CBS">CBS</a> from April 5 until May 10, 1982. It starred <a href="James%20Naughton">James Naughton</a>, <a href="Graham%20Jarvis">Graham Jarvis</a>, <a href="Alley%20Mills">Alley Mills</a>, <a href="Steven%20Peterman">Steven Peterman</a>, and boasted the first TV series roles for <a href="Philip%20Charles%20MacKenzie">Philip Charles MacKenzie</a> and <a href="George%20Wendt">George Wendt</a>. It was set at Franklin High School in <a href="St.%20Louis">St. Louis</a>, and aired as a part of CBS' Monday night comedy lineup. The theme song was a modified version of <a href="Tom%20Scott%20%28musician%29">Tom Scott</a>'s "Heading Home", which appeared on his "Street Beat" album three years earlier.
Among those shown were Harry Barnes, the Dean of Boys, Assistant Principal Jack Felspar, Drama teacher Sara Conover, and Physical education teacher Gus Bertoia.
US television ratings.
</onlyinclude>
